mode_name.name: Sensitivity and Speed (EM Amplifier)
mode_name.mode_description: Optimized for capturing weak signal at fast frame rates, with single photon sensitivity. Suited to the majority of EMCCD applciations

mode_name.name: Dynamic Range and Speed (EM Amplifier)
mode_name.mode_description: Configured to deliver optimal dynamic range at fast frame rates. Moderate EM gain applied

mode_name.name: Fastest Frame Rate (EM Amplifier)
mode_name.mode_description: For when its all about speed! Optimized for absolute fastest frame rates of the camera. Especially effective when combined with sub-array/binning selections

mode_name.name: Time Lapse (EM Amplifier)
mode_name.mode_description: Configured to capture low light images with time intervals between exposures. Overlap ('frame transfer') readout is deactivated

mode_name.name: Time Lapse and Short Exposures (EM Amplifier)
mode_name.mode_description: Configured to minimize vertical smear when using exposure times less than 3ms

mode_name.name: EMCCD Highest Dynamic Range (EM Amplifier)
mode_name.mode_description: Combines EMCCD low light detection with the absolute highest dynamic range that the camera can deliver. Since this requires slower readout, frame rate is sacrificed

mode_name.name: CCD Highest Dynamic Range (Conventional Amplifier)
mode_name.mode_description: Optimized for slow scan CCD detection with highest available dynamic range. Recommended for brighter signals OR when it is possible to apply long exposures to overcome noise floor

mode_name.name: Photon Counting
mode_name.mode_description: Configuration recommended for photon counting with individual exposures less than 10sec
